business.headline: 5 credit score myths you should stop believingYour credit score can open doors to better loans and credit cards, or shut them. Yet, many people still rely on half-truths and hearsay. Let's separate fact from fiction.

Sebi eases rules for foreign investors: Here's all you need to knowSebi plans to introduce simpler rules to make it easier for foreign investors to enter India's markets. The move aims to cut compliance burdens and attract more long-term overseas capital.

Indians sent abroad enough money in a decade to build 62 IITs, says RBI dataIn 2023–24 alone, students remitted about Rs 29,000 crore abroad for their studies, almost the same as the previous year. A decade ago, this figure was just Rs 2,429 crore.

Unified Pension Scheme offers security, but why aren't employees joining?With assured monthly income and inflation protection, UPS should have been an instant hit. Instead, uptake has been lukewarm. Here's why.

Sensex ends 304 points higher, Nifty above 24,600; pharma stocks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 304.32 points to 80,539.91, while the NSE Nifty50 added 131.95 points, finishing at 24,619.35. Broader market indices also ended the session in the green, as investor sentiment was lifted by favourable inflation data from both India and the US.
Inflation falls to an 8-year low, but are households feeling any relief?Inflation has fallen to an eight-year low, but are households really feeling the pinch ease in everyday expenses?
ChrysCapital takes over Theobroma bakery chain for Rs 2000 croresChrysCapital acquires majority control of Theobroma in a Rs 2,000 crore deal, with the founders retaining only a 10% minority stake.

Nithin Kamath explains how Sebi's quiet tech reform is empowering investorsBrokerage firms have to connect with several entities, like multiple stock exchanges, depositories, banks, and others. This meant hundreds of APIs and file formats had to be handled separately, creating hidden challenges behind the scenes.
SIPs, small-caps, and the Gen Z rush for high returnsGen Z investors are chasing big gains in mid- and small-cap funds, but soaring valuations and volatile markets mean the ride could get bumpy.

Tax perks, hidden costs, rental yield: What first-time homebuyers should knowStepping into the property market for the first time? Before you sign any papers, make sure you're financially prepared to handle not just the purchase price but the many hidden costs that follow. Here's a beginner's financial checklist to make your property investment a smart one.

NSDL rally hits roadblock after Q1 results, shares tumble nearly 5%. What next?After a strong IPO and initial rally, investors are reassessing NSDL's near-term growth prospects in light of mixed operational performance.
Explained: Why Paytm shares surged over 5% todayPaytm's share price rallied nearly 6% after RBI approval, lifting investor optimism amid steady business performance.

entertainment.headline: Film body seeks clarification from Badshah over Dallas event by Pakistani companyFWICE has written to Badshah seeking clarification on his Dallas concert sponsored by a Pakistani company. The move highlights tensions over cross-border collaborations amid rising national security concerns.

Task trailer: Mark Ruffalo races against time to catch suspicious criminalHBO's crime drama Task starring Mark Ruffalo will premiere on 7 September 2025. The series explores a tense moral clash within a family-led crime investigation in Philadelphia.

Mukesh Khanna questions Ranbir Kapoor's casting as Lord Rama in RamayanaActor Mukesh Khanna recently shared his views on the casting of the lead role in Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana'. He voiced his reservations about whether Ranbir Kapoor would be able to convincingly portray Lord Rama's 'Maryada Purushottam' image.
Richa Chadha says motherhood has calmed her rebel spiritActor Richa Chadha shared that since becoming a mother she speaks more gently and has grown more patient.

Exclusive: Priyanshu Painyulli wants a spin-off for Robin's character in MirzapurActor Priyanshu Painyulli, in an interview with India Today, expressed that his character Robin in 'Mirzapur' should have a spin-off. He also expressed how the character changed him and if he would be a part of the film based on the series.

West Bengal orders daily prime time Bengali films in all cinemasWest Bengal government has made it compulsory for all cinema halls to screen Bengali films daily during prime time. This move aims to boost regional cinema.

Kamal Haasan, Mammootty pay tribute to Rajinikanth on 50 glorious years in cinemaActors Kamal Haasan and Mammootty paid tribute to superstar Rajinikanth on the completion of his "glorious 50 years" in cinema. Apart from them, singer-composer Anirudh Ravichander and director Lokesh Kanagaraj also celebrated his golden jubilee in the film industry.

Saare Jahan Se Accha review: Taut spy tale with impactful performancesRelease Date:Wed Aug 13, 2025Saare Jahan Se Accha series review: The Netflix series explores the tense espionage between India and Pakistan in the 1960s and 70s. The series highlights the personal sacrifices behind nuclear rivalry and quiet patriotism.

Divya Khossla and Neil Nitin Mukesh's Ek Chatur Naar to release on this date. Posters outThe first-look posters of actors Divya Khossla and Neil Nitin Mukesh's film 'Ek Chatur Naar' were released on Wednesday. The thriller comedy is slated to hit the big screen in September.

Hrithik Roshan celebrates 1st teacher Rajinikanth's legacy amid War 2 vs CoolieHrithik Roshan celebrated Rajinikanth's 50 years in cinema with a special post on social media. This comes amid their films 'War 2' vas Coolie' at the box office.

KBC under fire again: A look at the show's most controversial momentsKaun Banega Crorepati is once again at the centre of controversy, this time over its Independence Day special featuring armed forces personnel. The backlash adds to a string of past moments that have sparked public debate and social media outrage.

Sushmita Sen recalls meeting Trump, says he wasn't very memorableActor Sushmita Sen opens up about overseeing Miss India Universe during Donald Trump's tenure as owner, sharing her honest thoughts on both the role and Trump.

Leonardo DiCaprio searched by cops at Ibiza party, Travis Scott denied entryOscar-winning actor Leonardo DiCaprio was briefly stopped and searched by cops at an exclusive tequila party in Ibiza. The incident highlights strict security measures at celebrity events despite star status.

Rajinikanth's fans perform rituals at Madurai temple praying for Coolie's successSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, will hit theatres on August 14. His fans performed several rituals at a temple in Madurai praying for the film's success.

Mrunal Thakur's new post amid Bipasha Basu body-shaming row: Stop staringActor Mrunal Thakur shared an Instagram post amid criticism of her comments on fellow actor Bipasha Basu. In the photos, Thakur was seen posing in an all-black outfit and matching sunglasses.

Akshay Kumar calls Twinkle's Tamma Tamma dance questionable in witty commentAkshay Kumar teased his wife, Twinkle Khanna, after she attempted to recreate Madhuri Dixit and Sanjay Dutt's 'Tamma Tamma' song went wrong.

Why Karnataka is enraged over demolition of Kannada icon Vishnuvardhan's memorialThe demolition of Kannada matinee icon Dr Vishnuvardhan's memorial in Bengaluru has sparked outrage among fans who condemned the act. Several actors, including Kichcha Sudeep and Rishab Shetty voiced their opinions on the matter, criticising the act.

With Love Meghan season 2 trailer: Meghan Markle's show to feature Jay Shetty'With Love, Meghan' is set to return on Netflix on August 26 with its second season. The trailer for the upcoming show was released on Tuesday. The second season will feature guests like television personalities Tan France, Chrissy Teigen and podcaster Jay Shetty.

Olivia Rodrigo's diamond ring fuels buzz about engagement to Louis PartridgePopstar Olivia Rodrigo was seen in Los Angeles with boyfriend Louis Partridge, wearing a diamond ring on her engagement finger, prompting speculation about a possible engagement.

general news.headline: Complainant Godse's kin: Rahul Gandhi claims threat to life over Savarkar remarkRahul Gandhi told a Pune court he faces a life threat from the complainant in a Savarkar defamation case, alleging the complainant is a descendant of Nathuram Godse with a history of violence.

Bihar SIR process voter-friendly: Supreme Court says 11 documents better than 7The Supreme Court backs Bihar's Special Intensive Revision of voter rolls as "voter-friendly," noting expanded ID options despite Aadhaar exclusion, while petitioners warn of possible mass disenfranchisement.

Oversaw killing of 2,800 stray dogs, buried as compost: Karnataka MLC sparks rowJD(S) Karnataka Legislative Council member claimed he oversaw the killing of 2,800 stray dogs in Chikkamagaluru. This comes at a time when the Supreme Court ordered authorities to immediately catch, sterilise, and permanently relocate stray dogs to shelters in Delhi-NCR.

Alaska, where Putin is meeting Trump, was Russian territory. US got it dirt cheapThere is a Russian-American real estate history to Alaska where US President Donald Trump is meeting Vladimir Putin, his Russian counterpart. Alaska was sold in 1867 by the Russian Tsar to the US for merely $7.2 million (roughly $160 million today). Alaska's story is one of America's smartest land deals that Trump would laud.

Dear Dump Truck, My Mercedes is Already Stalling Due to EthanolThe real threat to the Mercedes called India isn't Asim Munir's rickety dump truck. It's our own engine being corroded by ethanol of all kinds. The engine needs servicing and pure petrol so that others don't zoom past us.

Video: Tamil Nadu student, wife of DMK leader, snubs Governor RN Ravi at convocationA student avoided Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi during convocation and received her degree from the Vice Chancellor instead. She is the wife of a DMK leader and did so to reportedly highlight the standoff between the Governor and the government.
Sonia Gandhi's name added to voter roll before she was citizen: BJP's big chargeThe BJP's massive charge comes on the heels of Rahul Gandhi's claims of voter fraud in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls.

Why BEST society polls will be first ground test of Uddhav-Raj Thackeray pactThe Shiv Sena (UBT) and Maharashtra Navnirman Sena joining forces could galvanise their core Marathi voters in and around Mumbai and pay off in the BMC polls due this year

Life without parole: The state of Delhi-NCR strays?Anger-induced judgments that fail to consider practicality are now a reality in India. Dogs, who have lived with human beings for centuries, are facing unprecedented hate simply for their existence.

Independence Day meat ban wrong: Ajit Pawar sides with opposition in rare moveSiding with the Opposition in a rare move, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar slammed the orders by some civic bodies banning the sale of meat on Independence Day, saying it was wrong.

India's 'worst civil engineers': Are broken classrooms wrecking our infrastructure?For today's ambitious students, the choice is between building an app or building a bridge. Until we make the second option as rewarding as the first, our future will remain on shaky ground.

S Jaishankar to visit Russia next week after Trump's tariff blow over oil tradeS Jaishankar to visit Russia on August 20 and 21 and hold talks with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov. The visit comes days after the United States imposed an additional 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods.

Who is Aravind Srinivas, the man who made a bid to buy Google ChromeAravind Srinivas, the CEO and co-founder of Perplexity AI, was born in Chennai, India. He studied at IIT Madras before moving to the US for further education at the University of California, Berkeley.

Nasa to build nuclear reactor on the Moon: Is it possible by 2030?The project aims to create a reliable energy source for future moon bases, enabling extended human habitation and supporting advanced research far from Earth.

Vote anomaly in Andhra, Chandrababu Naidu has hotline with Rahul Gandhi: Jagan ReddyFormer Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy alleged the largest electoral anomaly in 2024 happened in the state. He accused Congress leaders of ignoring Andhra issues and claimed a hotline exists between Naidu, Revanth Reddy, and Rahul Gandhi.

Will Congress apologise, BJP smirks as Bihar's Minta Devi hits out at GandhisUnion Minister Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday criticised the Congress party and Opposition MPs for allegedly mocking a Bihar woman, Minta Devi, during their protest against the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls in Bihar.

Supreme Court stray dog order: Why rabies is deadly, what to do after a biteWhether the Supreme Court's order will lead to fewer dogs on the streets, and fewer bites in hospital emergency room is yet to be seen, until then, the best protection against rabies is still swift action, not wishful thinking, say doctors.

What next for Bengali migrants heeding Mamata call to return from BJP-ruled states?Bengali identity politics aside, the returnees pose both a humanitarian and socioeconomic integration challenge for the Trinamool Congress government

Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's love story: From friendship band to epic romanceTravis Kelce shared insights on his natural romance with Taylor Swift amid media attention. He recalled how he gifted her a friendship bracelet with his number on it.

Muzaffarpur Mayor 2nd BJP leader to get notice over dual voter ID card chargeThe notice comes amid the ongoing controversy surrounding the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls in the poll-bound state.

Why are teachers wary of failing students these daysIn India's no-fail classrooms, teachers bear the impossible burden of creating disciplined, capable citizens but without the authority to correct, fail, or hold students accountable.

Will look into it: Chief Justice amid fury over Supreme Court's stray dog orderRecently, the Supreme Court directed civic bodies to round up all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR within eight weeks and send them to shelters. The order triggered a backlash from animal activists and NGOs.

Rajiv Rudy triumphs in Delhi club battle that saw Amit Shah, Sonia Gandhi voteBJP leader Rajiv Pratap Rudy has maintained his 25-year-old dominance in the Constitution Club management, seeing off a challenge from his party colleague Sanjeev Balyan.

Khalistanis vandalise Hindu temple in US yet again, India seeks strict actionIn the fourth attack on a Hindu temple in the US this year, the Greenwood BAPS Mandir was defaced with anti-India and anti-Modi graffiti, allegedly by pro-Khalistan extremists. The incident has been condemned as a hate crime by advocacy groups. The Indian Consulate in Chicago has strongly denounced the act and urged local law enforcement to act promptly.

Film body seeks clarification from Badshah over Dallas event by Pakistani companyFWICE has written to Badshah seeking clarification on his Dallas concert sponsored by a Pakistani company. The move highlights tensions over cross-border collaborations amid rising national security concerns.

He voiced his reservations about whether Ranbir Kapoor would be able to convincingly portray Lord Rama's 'Maryada Purushottam' image.
Richa Chadha says motherhood has calmed her rebel spiritActor Richa Chadha shared that since becoming a mother she speaks more gently and has grown more patient.

sports.headline: England have a changed approach, they're trying to win and not entertain: LyonAustralia off-spinner Nathan Lyon has been left impressed with England's Bazball approach ahead of the Ashes in Australia. He said that they're more focused on winning matches instead of just entertaining.

National Sports Bill to be implemented within six months: Mansukh MandaviyaThe National Sports Governance Bill will be implemented fully within six months, introducing key reforms in Indian sports. The law formalises government powers in international participation and ensures athlete representation, aiming to boost India's global sports standing.

Radha, Yastika shine as India A Women clinch 1st One-Dayer vs AustraliaRadha Yadav picked up three wickets while Yastika Bhatia scored 59 as India A Women took a 1-0 lead in the series with a three-wicket win over Australia A Women.

Marcus Rashford hits out at Manchester United's endless managerial shuffleMarcus Rashford says Manchester United's constant managerial changes and lack of a long-term plan have left the club "in no man's land," stressing that true success needs stability, principles, and a clear footballing identity.

Virat Kohli comparison main reason behind Babar Azam's downfall: Ahmed ShehzadPakistan batter Ahmed Shehzad has said that comparisons with Virat Kohli is the main reason behind Babar Azam's downfall in international cricket.

15-year streak in danger as Indians handed tough World Championships drawsBWF World Championships 2025: India's Lakshya Sen and HS Prannoy have been handed tough draws. Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty shoulder India's hopes of extending a 15-year streak.

South Africa's Bosch handed demerit point for Dwarshuis send-off in second T20ISouth Africa all-rounder Corbin Bosch has been handed a demerit point for his send-off of Ben Dwarshuis during the second T20I against Australia on Tuesday.

Test cricket could send nations bankrupt, Cricket Australia boss saysThe Australian cricket board chief suggested that forcing other nations to play Test cricket could be a financial loss for certain nations, and reckons that scarcity in Test cricket could be more of an asset.

Arne Slot's special message as Liverpool gear up for new season without JotaLiverpool's Arne Slot and Jurgen Klopp paid heartfelt tribute to the late Diogo Jota, reflecting on his enduring legacy both on and off the pitch. The pair lauded Jota's immense contributions to Liverpool, his national team, Portugal, and his family, highlighting the impact he had on those around him.

A UFC event at the White House? Dana White says it's happeningDana White has confirmed that a one-off UFC event is in the works to be held at the White House. The event is expected to be held on the USA's 250th Independence Day.

Wanted to leave KKR despite winning IPL 2014: Robin Uthappa's big revelationFormer KKR opener Robin Uthappa has said that he wanted to leave the team after the 2014 season to earn more at the auction table. Despite winning the Orange Cap and guiding the team to the title, the franchise refused to release him for the next auction.

South Africa's Bosch handed demerit point for Dwarshuis send-off in second T20ISouth Africa all-rounder Corbin Bosch has been handed a demerit point for his send-off of Ben Dwarshuis during the second T20I against Australia on Tuesday.

Test cricket could send nations bankrupt, Cricket Australia boss saysThe Australian cricket board chief suggested that forcing other nations to play Test cricket could be a financial loss for certain nations, and reckons that scarcity in Test cricket could be more of an asset.

Arne Slot's special message as Liverpool gear up for new season without JotaLiverpool's Arne Slot and Jurgen Klopp paid heartfelt tribute to the late Diogo Jota, reflecting on his enduring legacy both on and off the pitch. The pair lauded Jota's immense contributions to Liverpool, his national team, Portugal, and his family, highlighting the impact he had on those around him.

A UFC event at the White House? Dana White says it's happeningDana White has confirmed that a one-off UFC event is in the works to be held at the White House. The event is expected to be held on the USA's 250th Independence Day.

Wanted to leave KKR despite winning IPL 2014: Robin Uthappa's big revelationFormer KKR opener Robin Uthappa has said that he wanted to leave the team after the 2014 season to earn more at the auction table. Despite winning the Orange Cap and guiding the team to the title, the franchise refused to release him for the next auction.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
